identificationModule.briefTitle: Ibrutinib Plus Venetoclax for First-Line Treatment of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Ibrutinib Plus Venetoclax for First-Line Treatment of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia: Primary Analysis Results From the Minimal Residual Disease Cohort of the Randomized Phase II CAPTIVATE Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: CAPTIVATE (NCT02910583) is a randomized phase II study evaluating minimal residual disease (MRD)-guided treatment discontinuation following completion of first-line ibrutinib plus venetoclax treatment in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL). The study investigates whether fixed-duration treatment with this all-oral, chemotherapy-free regimen is feasible based on deep remission status.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Eligible patients aged < 70 years with previously untreated CLL or SLL received three cycles of single-agent ibrutinib lead-in followed by 12 cycles of combined ibrutinib plus venetoclax. Following this treatment phase, patients in the MRD cohort were assessed for Confirmed undetectable MRD (uMRD). Patients meeting the stringent criteria for Confirmed uMRD were randomly assigned 1:1 to double-blind treatment with placebo or ibrutinib. Patients who did not meet Confirmed uMRD criteria (uMRD Not Confirmed) were randomly assigned 1:1 to open-label treatment with single-agent ibrutinib or continued ibrutinib plus venetoclax. The primary endpoint was the 1-year disease-free survival (DFS) rate with placebo versus ibrutinib in the Confirmed uMRD population. Secondary endpoints included undetectable MRD rates in peripheral blood and bone marrow, overall response rates, progression-free survival, overall survival, and safety.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Patients received 3 cycles of ibrutinib lead-in followed by 12 cycles of combined ibrutinib plus venetoclax. Patients with Confirmed uMRD were randomly assigned 1:1 to double-blind placebo or ibrutinib; patients without Confirmed uMRD were randomly assigned 1:1 to open-label ibrutinib or ibrutinib plus venetoclax.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Patients with Confirmed uMRD were randomly assigned 1:1 to double-blinded treatment with placebo or ibrutinib. Patients with uMRD Not Confirmed were randomly assigned 1:1 to open-label treatment.

armGroups.label: Confirmed uMRD: Placebo
armGroups.description: Patients with Confirmed undetectable minimal residual disease (uMRD) after 12 cycles of combined ibrutinib plus venetoclax were randomly assigned to receive double-blind placebo.

armGroups.label: Confirmed uMRD: Ibrutinib
armGroups.description: Patients with Confirmed undetectable minimal residual disease (uMRD) after 12 cycles of combined ibrutinib plus venetoclax were randomly assigned to receive double-blind ibrutinib.

armGroups.label: uMRD Not Confirmed: Ibrutinib
armGroups.description: Patients without Confirmed uMRD (uMRD Not Confirmed) after 12 cycles of combined ibrutinib plus venetoclax were randomly assigned to receive open-label ibrutinib.

armGroups.label: uMRD Not Confirmed: Ibrutinib + Venetoclax
armGroups.description: Patients without Confirmed uMRD (uMRD Not Confirmed) after 12 cycles of combined ibrutinib plus venetoclax were randomly assigned to receive open-label ibrutinib plus venetoclax.

interventions.name: Venetoclax
interventions.description: Administered orally, target dose 400 mg once daily.

primaryOutcomes.description: DFS rate with placebo versus ibrutinib in the Confirmed uMRD population. One-year DFS was defined as absence of MRD relapse, progression, or death.

secondaryOutcomes.description: uMRD rates assessed in peripheral blood (PB) and bone marrow (BM).
Assessed per investigator assessment using 2008 iwCLL criteria.
Includes CR with incomplete BM recovery (CRi).
Time from documentation of tumor response to disease progression or death.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Tumor Lysis Syndrome (TLS) Risk Category Reduction
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients at high risk for TLS after ibrutinib lead-in versus baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and after 3 cycles of ibrutinib lead-in

secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from random assignment to disease progression or death.
Time from random assignment to death from any cause.
Pharmacokinetic sampling of ibrutinib and venetoclax in combination.

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Evaluated at every visit throughout the study

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 18 to < 70 years
- Previously untreated chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) requiring treatment per iwCLL criteria
- Measurable nodal disease by computed tomography
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0-1
- Adequate hepatic, renal, and hematologic function

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to xanthine oxidase inhibitors and/or rasburicase
